{{Infobox figure skater |name= Jason Wong |image= |caption= |fullname= Jason Wong |altname= |country= [[United States]] |formercountry= |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1986|6|22}} |birth_place= [[Lexington, Massachusetts]] |hometown= |residence= |death_date= |death_place= |height= {{height|ft=5|in=9}} |partner= |formerpartner= |coach= [[Suna Murray]] |formercoach=[[Mark Mitchell (American figure skater)|Mark Mitchell]], [[Peter Johansson (figure skater)|Peter Johansson]] |choreographer= [[Scott Brown (figure skater)|Scott Brown]], [[Jamie Isley]]
[[SÃ©bastien Britten]] |formerchoreographer= |skating club= [[Skating Club of Boston]] |retired= |combined total= 145.15 |combined date= [[2004-2005 JGP|2004 JGP France]] |SP score= 48.67 |SP date= [[2004-2005 JGP|2004 JGP France]] |FS score= 96.48 |FS date= [[2004-2005 JGP|2004 JGP France]] }} '''Jason Wong''' (born June 22, 1986 in [[Lexington, Massachusetts]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[Figure skating|figure skater]]. He is the 2004 [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. junior silver medalist]] and the 2010 U.S. Collegiate Champion. He competed for three seasons on the [[ISU Junior Grand Prix]]. ==Competitive highlights== {| class="wikitable" |- !
